name: BOTANIST
description: Airy, high-end restaurant in the Fairmont Hotel offering modern Canadian cuisine, wine & cocktails.
address: BOTANIST, 1038 Canada Pl, Vancouver, BC V6C 0B9

featured_reviews.review_id: The service was amazing, they even remembered your name throughout the whole dining. I was here for brunch and it was great experience. However, the food can be better, it was nicely presented but I didn't enjoy the medium rare steak. The coffee smelled good but they can do better, it was 'watery' for me.
featured_reviews.review_text: The service was amazing, they even remembered your name throughout the whole dining. I was here for brunch and it was great experience. However, the food can be better, it was nicely presented but I didn't enjoy the medium rare steak. The coffee smelled good but they can do better, it was 'watery' for me.

featured_reviews.review_id: Service here was super welcoming. Shocking for such a high end area. Especially for how they treat people of color. Impressive. Food was really good, overall the menu has things other restaurants do but everything is served and made meticulously, you can tell there's a lot of effort put into everything. Servers are friendly and flexible. Good experience and the atmosphere is welcoming too!
featured_reviews.review_text: Service here was super welcoming. Shocking for such a high end area. Especially for how they treat people of color. Impressive. Food was really good, overall the menu has things other restaurants do but everything is served and made meticulously, you can tell there's a lot of effort put into everything. Servers are friendly and flexible. Good experience and the atmosphere is welcoming too!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Celebrated a birthday lunch here - cocktails are amazing, food is beautiful. "Garden area" wasn't open but it's stunning. They have a couple private rooms avail to book. The Botanist bar has its own menu but is only open for dinner service. Service was kind but not exceptional, didn't recognize or acknowledge this special day for us. The fresh bread was forgotten, we had to ask but then promptly delivered.
Burrata salad and tartare was underwhelming. Hanger steak was delicious.
featured_reviews.review_text:

featured_reviews.review_id:
This is a pretty nice restaurant that is enjoyable.   Location and decor is great, food is prepared with quality ingredients and presented very well.  Portions are a little small for the price so you end up ordering more of a variety of appetizers which has its own benefits.    The Hamburger is the main dish we tried and while a good burger (BTW it's served medium well so it's very pink inside) it was over powered by the strong and sharp cheese flavours.    I would consider asking them for some kind of modifications to make it a little more impressive in some way.     The chairs have some weird construction with the metal braces that hold the legs together that protrude and could damage leggings and general is a annoying

Overall enjoyable, fancy and very pleasant.

featured_reviews.review_id: We had an amazing time at the restaurant. We enjoyed the chef's tasting menu, one of our guests had some dietary requirements and the kitchen expertly pivoted and created a tantalizing spread of food. The efficiency and care of service was very apparent our service was above average and our server went to great lengths to go above and beyond to ensure every guest was satisfied with the tasting menu and their experience with the restaurant. It truly is a magical experience dining somewhere where you are taking such great care of and the use of unique and beautiful ingredients are so present.
featured_reviews.review_text: We had an amazing time at the restaurant. We enjoyed the chef's tasting menu, one of our guests had some dietary requirements and the kitchen expertly pivoted and created a tantalizing spread of food. The efficiency and care of service was very apparent our service was above average and our server went to great lengths to go above and beyond to ensure every guest was satisfied with the tasting menu and their experience with the restaurant. It truly is a magical experience dining somewhere where you are taking such great care of and the use of unique and beautiful ingredients are so present.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Can't say enough good things about our time at Botanist! We came for our wedding anniversary and had a beautiful card and champagne waiting for us at the table. The hostesses were very courteous and our server, Chris, was amazing. He thoroughly explained different menu options to make sure the experience was catered to our tastes and checked on us often from the appetizers through the main course to dessert.

The atmosphere was wonderful. We sat in the semi-outdoor seating area near the bar with beautiful foliage and piano playing in the background.

One thing to note: be wary of the bread--delicious and so tempting to keep eating it but save your appetite for the main course and you won't be sorry. Tagliatelle, poached halibut, and king salmon were perfect along with the raspberry pavlova. Also enjoyed our drinks: "What the Flower" and "Needed Escape".

Would definitely recommend!

Would definitely recommend!

featured_reviews.review_id:
Out of all the amazing restaurants in Vancouver, my wife and I decided to celebrate our anniversary here and it turned out to be a very wise choice!

Kudos to the mastermind, Sarkis, who orchestrated a table miracle on our special night, spreading the word to the entire staff as our fantastic night capped off with two glasses of complimentary champagne to toast with right away before getting to the menu.

My wife's favourite was the butter poached lobster! The plating was beautifully presented and the sauce was tastefully done, not overpowering the natural sweetness of the fresh lobster!

My favourite was the oven roasted cauliflower. The cauliflower is like a white canvas that provides the texture and everything else on the plate just meshed so well and tasted so heavenly together. This is a definitely a MUST TRY!

Ambiance was delightful, complemented by the remarkable skills of a pianist who effortlessly transitioned from contemporary jazz to Spirited Away soundtracks! Adding to the experience, our waiter was also super friendly and made sure we had everything that we needed. All and all it was a great night and we would definitely go back to celebrate another important day!"

featured_reviews.review_id:
I came here for cocktails. I'm sure the food is great, and ideally, I would have enjoyed the chance to taste it, but I only had an hour and I'd heard amazing things about their cocktail program so that was my only intention.

And it was worth it.

There are a lot of bars on the "official" Best Bars of 202_ and of the ones I've tried, often they're pretty underwhelming. I don't know who chooses them or how much money a bar has to pay to be on them, but most of the time, it doesn't seem to match with my experiences.

Botanist, however, does belong on that list. Is it the best cocktail bar ever? No. But it is an exceptionally good hotel bar? Yes.

Arguably, hotel bars have a much more difficult task than a regular cocktail bar because they have to appeal to a much wider range of tastes, people, and experiences. Generally, they're fairly generic, and play it safe with flavours, never straying too far from trends or accessibility of the most inexperienced tourist.

That's why Botanist is special. Sure, sitting at the bar, I saw people be boring and order Aperol Spritzes and wines and espresso martinis.  But the cocktail menu is so much more. It's big, for one thing. Has a great deal of diversity. You can find any sort of drink from a fizzy, sweet concoction to a serious spirit-forward sipper.

What I enjoyed most was the marriage of very BC/Canadian ingredients with spirits, some of which are fairly rare to find on a hotel bar cocktail list. Both that I tried were delicious, and mostly important for me, you can actually taste and feel the booze. Sure, one of them (Council of Trees -- amazing name!) seemed pretty juicy and easy, but you could *feel* it by the last sip. What a sneaky drink. I loved it. That's what I'm looking for: cool flavours, mixed and balanced so well that I barely can tell it's a cocktail but hits hard enough that I don't say, "Well, I could have just ordered a lemonade." Don't get me wrong, you can taste the interesting scotch, but it wasn't too much or too little. I'm going to be honest: I saw the Council of Trees on their menu online weeks ahead of time when planning my trip and knew I had to try it. I adored the botanical ingredients, and even its little cryptic blurb on the menu. If nothing else, I was going to try it. And it did not disappoint.

The second cocktail (Stone Fox) was a lot heavier, and very spirit-forward, which I appreciate on a cocktail menu. Especially hotels. As a cognac lover, I had to try it. It was a little heavy on the sweet apricot for me personally, but a lot of people would like it this way.

Shout out to the great bar snacks, too. They do not skimp. It was almost like a tapa, that's how much you get and it's good quality too.

Bartenders were sociable but not overbearing and seemed to nail the choices for other patrons. The bar area itself is small, and not exactly the coziest as it's right in the corridor leading from the entrance to the restaurant, but if you're only having a drink or two, it's totally fine. Hostess was super-nice and accommodating.

Would definitely come back.
